intro: Schizoglossum gwelense, commonly known as the Gwelense spurge, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
